socioeconomic_impact_studies.measure: Qualitative description of clinical burden: osmotic diarrhea, abdominal pain, rectal flatulence
socioeconomic_impact_studies.label: Trehalase deficiency

socioeconomic_impact_studies.measure: Total cost per rare disease patient per year (societal perspective)
socioeconomic_impact_studies.label: Socio-economic costs of rare diseases and the risk of financial hardship: a cross-sectional study

socioeconomic_impact_studies.measure: Average cost burden per rare disease patient per year
socioeconomic_impact_studies.label: Chiesi Global Rare Diseases Releases Report on the Burden of Care for Rare Diseases and Its Economic Impact on European Citizens

justification: No specific cost-of-illness study for Trehalase deficiency was identified, but a peer-reviewed pan-European analysis reported an average annual cost of €37,187 per rare disease patient in Spain, and a European industry report estimated a €107,000 per patient per year burden across 23 rare diseases, providing medium-high evidence for significant economic impact.
